repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Fares Center for Eastern Mediterranean Studies Occasional Papers

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Fares Center for Eastern Mediterranean Studies

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of print and digital copies of the Fares Center for Eastern Mediterranean Studies Occasional Papers which document the procedings of various conferences sponsored by the Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 1991, Fares I. Fares, a trustee and member of Tufts' International Board of Overseers and the Board of Overseers for Arts and Sciences and the son of former trustee Issam M. Fares (Deputy Prime Minister of Lebanon), first conceived of a lectures series to further understanding of the issues facing the Middle East. Today, the Issam M. Fares Lecture Series is the fulfillment of that idea. The lecture series is supported by an endowment from the Fares Foundation that enables Tufts University to implement a program for promoting Middle Eastern studies in the humanities, social sciences, and arts, including history, political science, economics, sociology, anthropology, demographic studies, and languages.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is processed and open for research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports on conferences sponsored by the Fares Center.
